dt: {bc}of or relating to the general public
{bc}adapted to or indicative of the understanding and taste of the majority
{bc}suited to the means of the majority {bc}{sx|inexpensive||}

pt: {sc}common{/sc} {sc}ordinary{/sc} {sc}plain{/sc} {sc}familiar{/sc} {sc}popular{/sc} {sc}vulgar{/sc} mean generally met with and not in any way special, strange, or unusual. {sc}common{/sc} implies usual everyday quality or frequency of occurrence
and may additionally suggest inferiority or coarseness.
{sc}ordinary{/sc} stresses conformance in quality or kind with the regular order of things.
{sc}plain{/sc} is likely to suggest homely simplicity.
{sc}familiar{/sc} stresses the fact of being generally known and easily recognized.
{sc}popular{/sc} applies to what is accepted by or prevalent among people in general sometimes in contrast to upper classes or special groups.
{sc}vulgar{/sc}, otherwise similar to {sc}popular{/sc}, is likely to carry derogatory connotations (as of inferiority or coarseness).

pt.t: souvenirs designed to appeal to the {it}vulgar{/it} taste

et: Latin {it}popularis{/it}, from {it}populus{/it} the people, a people
shortdef: of or relating to the general public
suitable to the majority: such as
adapted to or indicative of the understanding and taste of the majority

dt: {bc}a coalition especially of leftist political parties against a common opponent
{bc}one sponsored and dominated by Communists as a device for gaining power

shortdef: a coalition especially of leftist political parties against a common opponent; specifically : one sponsored and dominated by Communists as a device for gaining power

dt: {bc}a doctrine in political theory that government is created by and subject to the will of the people
{bc}a pre-Civil War doctrine asserting the right of the people living in a newly organized territory to decide by vote of their territorial legislature whether or not slavery would be permitted there

shortdef: a doctrine in political theory that government is created by and subject to the will of the people
a pre-Civil War doctrine asserting the right of the people living in a newly organized territory to decide by vote of their territorial legislature whether or not slavery would be permitted there

dt: {bc}a request made by or a desire shared by many people

dt.t: Because of {it}popular demand{/it}, the restaurant has published a cookbook of favorite recipes.
The show will continue for another week due to {it}popular demand{/it}.
The circus will be back {phrase}by popular demand{/phrase} later this summer.

shortdef: a request made by or a desire shared by many people

dt: {bc}the feelings that many or most have about what is appealing, attractive, etc.

dt.t: The movie is intended to appeal to {it}popular taste{/it}.

shortdef: the feelings that many or most have about what is appealing, attractive, etc.

dt: {bc}opposing what is popular {bc}deliberately or emphatically unpopular

shortdef: opposing what is popular : deliberately or emphatically unpopular

dt.t: {it}Contrary to popular belief{/it}, these animals are not really dangerous to humans.
{it}Contrary to popular opinion{/it}, fame does not always bring happiness.
